data.title: Purely, AWESOME!
data.text: Great staff. Absolutely the freshest fish for your Friday Fish Fry. They offer 1 of the BEST burgers in the area. Honestly there is not a bad thing on their menu. The night life scene is totally enjoyable as well. Saturday nights they have 1 of the BEST DJ's in the area spinning Top 40, Hip Hop, and some dance. Just worth the trip if you are in the area.

data.title: Great food and Reasonable prices
data.text: Hubby and I were quite surprised by the diverse menu and fantastic service. I asked for the hamburger on their own flatbread and what a great choice! Hubby was disappointed that the pork chops had no sage dressing (not mentioned when he ordered) food was excellent and I would recommend.

data.title: What a surprise!
data.text:
After thinks no I wasn't going to find anything but pub fare in Waukesha, I was so pleased to find Meli.
I'd come for the Greek salad alone. The "small" salad was anything but and it was dressed beautifully and full of wonderful peppers, tomatoes, olives and feta. My risotto was good, though after the Greek salad it seemed a bit bland. My husband had the chicken flatbread, which he liked. It came with a side and he got fresh fruit. 
We were having trouble choosing a glass of wine so the server brought us tastes of two. 
The food was great, service wonderful and the place is attractive and inviting,

data.title: Always a great time
data.text: My husband and I have been to the Meli bar several times and it has become our favorite place in downtown Waukesha. Great service, fabulous food and always a relaxing and enjoyable atmosphere. The menu is a great mix of Mediterranean and good blended flavors. Can't wait to try their Friday fish fry

data.title: Private Party for 20
data.text: This is a great restaurant and bar.  Warm and comfortable with a great beer and wine offering.  Owner and Chef Llazar is friendly and accommodating.  The menu is Greek influenced with hummus, kabobs but he also offers a variety of American favorites.  Our party was a huge success.  Our guest of honor is from Israel, so I wanted him to have some Mediterranean favorites.  He was not disappointed and neither were our 20 guests.  Chef Llazar handled the menu and all of the details.  If you haven't been there, you're missing a great dining experience.  Not too hungry?  They have a nice selection of fresh made appetizers--which go perfectly with a glass of wine or a cold beer!

data.title: Awesome fish fry !
data.text: Visited Meli  this past Friday and knowing it was a Mediterranean style restaurant still decided (because it was a Friday night in WI) to try the fish fry.  So glad I did -what a pleasant surprise!  Great light and crispy perfectly seasoned cod fish and a really wonderful tarter sauce that was not too sweet and had a great caper/lemon flavor to it -different than usual tartar sauces.  Portions were generous and great price too! !

data.title: Bad experience
data.text:
We were to meet another couple for the Waukesha Friday nights live.
 Their first experience with this, and wanting them to have a good experience. We decided to try out Meli.
  First off we were told a 40 minute wait for a sidewalk table. Fair enough after all the crowds were out. after checking out music 
we returned , were seated and left alone for another 20 minutes. As we were about to find out why a waitress comes over. " Have you been helped?" " No we haven't." Another ten minutes and nobody comes by. We left having waited over an hour. Very poor service don't waste your time here there are better restaurants there.

data.title: Unique atmosphere and menu. Wonderful night out
data.text: Loved the variety of unique and comfortable seating options. Modern & fun decor. Menu was out of the ordinary. Love that. Tried things we wouldn't normally eat. Loved everything. Cleaned our plates. Hope to go back again soon. Introduced us to Boursin cheese. Yum. And their linguini was spectacular and I am not a huge fan of pasta. Fabulous steak and lamb dinners. Great place to go for a very enjoyable night out.

data.title: Good Food but Poor Service
data.text: We went on a Friday evening and were seated immediately. Our service was very poor. We asked for glasses to drink our beer out of  (which we never received). Our appetizers arrived and we had no plates, silverware or napkins. We had to ask for these items 3 times and of course our server was in no hurry. When we finally received these items, the server threw them on our table. We were apparently being irritating for wanting silverware to eat our food with and, of course, our apps were cold by this point. The food was very tastey but the portions were quite small comparable to the prices. We will not return.

data.title: Mule Mondays -What?
data.text:
A nice place in downtown Waukesha. On Monday nights it is $5 Moscow (and other) Mules - a good value and a good drink.

The menu for my tastes was very limited (could have used a gyro here!). I ordered the burger and it was quite good and done medium rare as ordered. The others in our group liked what they ordered. Service was friendly and efficient.

Again a decent place but it just did not "trip my trigger"

data.title: Interesting Menu
data.text: Located in downtown Waukesha, this restaurant concentrates on serving unfamiliar dishes from the eastern Mediterranean in he heart Wisconsin. We joined friends there for dinner on a Saturday night. Because of the eternal destruction and reconstruction of Waukesha's central city roads, you need to park behind the restaurant in the Riverwalk area and walk over to its entrance on Main St. When we arrived, our reservations, made via the restaurant's Website, were nowhere to be found. We were told, "That's often a problem!" Luckily there were plenty of tables available, presumably due, in part, to the aforementioned road construction and street closure. The menu's the thing here, so we decided to try some unfamiliar dishes starting with a Saganaki appetizer featuring flaming imported Kefalotiri cheese fired right at your table. Interesting and tasty, but we had to ask for some crostini's to spread the cheese on. Most of us decided to go with a small plate and a salad for dinner. I chose to have the House "Bar" cuterie which included a sampling house specialities including falafel and rice balls as well as chicken wings (no, really legs) and Kalamaki (chicken/veggies ke-babs). Mostly good, not great. I had a crab Louie salad for my main course-kind of fishy, mushy and warm and not so great. Others had gnocchi and beet salad which they enjoyed, though the beet salad was short on beets. Overall, the food was OK, but didn't quite match the excitement of the menu itself. On the other hand our server, Isaiah was personable and very attentive. We enjoyed him. Well worth a look, just to experience a different style of food, but they need to work a bit on the food side of things if they hope to become a major culinary magnet.

data.title: A nice evening out
data.text: We go here before our show at the Waukesha Community Theater. I like the atmosphere and I actually really like the food. It's a nice sit-down Mediterranean with good specials, good mixed drinks and friendly staff.

data.title: Nice Atmosphere,  friendly service...
data.text:
We ate at Meli with another couple. Had the best table on the place, right on the front window. The owners young son came to say hello.
The service was efficient and friendly. 
House Merlot was tasty. We started with the squash soup, EXCELLENT!
We each ordered a different entree. Burger was a bit over cooked. The vegetarian dishes were yummy, curry swai could have  used a bit more flavor.
Over all we had a wonderful experience,  there are so many more tasty things to try!
Might be the finest restaurant in Waukesha.

data.title: Great concept, execution needs some work
data.text:
The menu looks terrific, with a wide range of options with a Mediterranean influence.  In addition, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, including being gracious with a returned dish.  We recently moved to Waukesha County and are always looking for great little places like this with interesting menus and cocktails that aren't part of some conglomerate.  That's why it saddens me to have a not-great review.

We started with saganaki, which I haven't had in years.  It was served properly (including the "opa!") and was a great starter - tasty but not too filling.  I then ordered the grilled flank steak with chimichurri (I'm a sucker for chimichurri), cooked medium-rare.  Unfortunately, when I got it, it was entirely gray and chewy.  When the waitress checked on us, she saw immediately that it was nowhere near MR and whisked it away.  She quickly returned with a MR steak.  Unfortunately, this steak quickly finished cooking on my plate - I can't fault the cook for this because s/he had to cook it QUICK to let me eat my meal with my husband.

The steak was served not with the chimichurri on top, as usual and as described on the menu, but on top of the chimi.  This immediately cooked the chimi, with the result that it kind of just tasted like salty grass clippings.  Chimi is a great steak-topper because the brightness of the fresh cilantro/parsley contrasts nicely with the beef.

The side dishes did not save the meal, either.  Neither the roasted potatoes nor the seasonal vegetables had any discernable seasoning - even a bit of olive oil on the veggies would have been appreciated.  The veggies seemed to be steamed with no fat or salt added, and included cubed eggplant which I first took to be mushroom.  Steamed, unseasoned eggplant is not tasty.

On the upside, Meli carries a fish I'd never heard of before - swai - which my husband ordered.  It was delicious!  A white-fleshed, tender mild fish served on a really nice bed of creamed roasted cauliflower.  Who knew farmed catfish could be a standout?!

Overall, the space is really nice, and I suspect the craft cocktails are worth a look (my menu was missing the cocktail page).  I'd probably go back and try some cocktails and small plates, and I hope a little adjusting in the kitchen will make Meli into the standout I think it could be.

data.title: Nice atmosphere; great food!
data.text: We chose this restaurant while walking downtown Waukesha, and weren't disappointed. The steak sandwich special on Texas toast was excellent, as was the Greek salad. The decor was fresh, with nice wood and artwork throughout. Yes, it did take awhile for our lunch order to come out, but we enjoyed the atmosphere and the view out onto the 5 downtown. Also, they gave us free drink refills. Based on this visit, we're going to make sure that we dine in the downtown area at least once a month from now on!

data.title: Interesting menu, well prepared
data.text: Great restaurant. The menu has interesting dishes like you might expect in Walkers Point, but because it is Waukesha the prices are lower and you can find a place to park. They serve small plates to pass around as well as large plates that you can also pass around or eat on your own. We especially liked the mushroom risotto and the braised lamb gnocchi. Decor is modern with plenty of the art that is starting to distinguish Waukesha.

data.title: Excellent Dining Experience
data.text: The staff was welcoming, helpful in their suggestions, and pleasant throughout the meal.  The food was outstanding.  All four members of our party had different selections, and each dinner was excellent.  The atmosphere was very pleasant, although a little loud as the place got crowded.  We went for an earlier dinner.  If you prefer latter, I suggest making a reservation.  We will certainly return when in the area again.

data.title: Not your usual yada yada... Nice options... but...
data.text:
Meli is part of the great evening scene in Waukesha that has emerged in recent years.  To get a seat on a Friday evening is possible, but not easy.

The menu has a wide range of options from comfort food (Meli Burger) to the exotic (Egyptian veggie dish).  You'll find really interesting flavors here.  The curry dressing for the quinoa/sweet potato salad is fully flavored and a great change from the usual bar fare.

The service is super friendly... you'll feel like you're part of the neighborhood.  It is reasonably efficient, but not high brow... "Do you want to save your fork?"  They were properly apologetic when it turned out that my wife didn't find the food as good as she had hoped and asked for us to give them another try.

As others have noted, the serving sizes are small and some may find them to be over expensive.

All and all, a nice change of pace, but with a few kinks still to work out.

data.title: Ultra Cool Space and Great Healthy Menu
data.text: From out of town, my wife and I found Meli when we were looking for a lunch spot in downtown Waukesha.  The space is very sleek and a window table was a perfect spot to watch pedestrians go by.  We wanted healthy meals and Meli has several options which we found to be quite tasty and very reasonably priced.  The owners/managers also cheerfilly filled a small jug of ours with ice and water when we asked.  It was a terrific lunch in a place with a great vibe and terrific service.  Highly recommended and seemed to be a good choice for evening cocktails and casual dining.

data.title: Excellent food; slow service
data.text: Went for lunch with a friend. As others have stated, the food was excellent, but the service was slow. We had the seared salmon on a pretzel bun. Wow! The server was nice enough, but she was obviously in no rush to get to us.
